intro: Bactris planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaf palm, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and broad, paddle-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible fruits resembling small, round coconuts. Its leaves are often used in traditional crafts and as thatching material. Bactris planifolia is well adapted to humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
